intro: Mammillaria seitziana, commonly known as the Seitz's mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and a dense covering of small, white spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking contrast to its green body. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and hardiness, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
